meanings.definition: To transfer ownership or control of (a business, industry, or service) from public to private ownership or control.
meanings.sent1: The government reprivatizes the company, giving it back to private owners.
meanings.sent2: The city council decided to reprivatize the public transportation system.
meanings.sent3: After the mishap, the mayor jokingly said he would reprivatize the city's coffee supply.
meanings.sent4: The decision to reprivatize the struggling airline breathed new life into the industry.
meanings.sent5: She believed that reprivatizing the bookstore would lead to better service and products.

meanings.definition: To return to private ownership or control.
meanings.sent1: The government reprivatizes the previously nationalized company.
meanings.sent2: The community voted to reprivatize the public park.
meanings.sent3: The magician joked that he could reprivatize the rabbit he pulled out of the hat.
meanings.sent4: The decision to reprivatize the historic building sparked controversy.
meanings.sent5: The family decided to reprivatize their business after years of being publicly owned.
